bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Walt Whitman to Hannah Whitman Heyde, 3 October 1891
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

body.p: Am pleas'dpleased you get my notes entirely unopen'dunopened—the money is for your service — warm weather here yet — badly sick all the week — & yet — have pass'dpassed most of the day stretch'dstretched out on the bed — Mrs. DDavis sick quite badly — neuralgia — Warry my nurse is helpful & good — of course I am up now & sitting by the window in pretty fair spirits — have had my supper — drank a cup of hot tea — am sweating — how short the days are getting

closer.salute: Love to you sister dear — hope & pray this will find you comfortable — 2 enc'denclosed
